intro: Stenia uribei, commonly known as the Uribei's stenia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in coastal and sandy soils. It is often found in tropical and subtropical environments, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
